intro: Oxydectes rudolphiana, commonly known as the Rudolph's orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, spurred flowers that range in color from deep red to orange, with intricate patterns. It typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, preferring cool and humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
